intro: Hieracium euchloodes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium euchloodes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its aggressive spreading habit.
